headline: Ondo deploys Amotekun to prisons after soldiers’ withdrawal
summarized_story:

The Amotekun corps were deployed to the correctional centres alongside other security agents from the state commands of the Nigeria Police Force and the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSCDC.

headline: Renowned Islamic scholar, Dr Ahmad BUK dies in Kano
summarized_story:

headline: Agric growth under Buhari weakest since 1999 despite investment

headline: We are not involved in war of words over insecurity
summarized_story:
The All Progressive Congress APC loyal to Senator Kabiru Marafa in Zamfara state has distance self from the recent allegation by the Matawalle’s led Faction of the party that some members of the PDP owns over seventy percent of all mining sites in the state“We seek to be counted out of this madness” The Marafa’s Faction saidA press statement signed by the spokesperson of Senator Marafas-led faction Bello Bakyasuwa Maradun under the Chairmanship of Sirajo Garba Maikatako condemns the allegation and consider it baseless, careless and irresponsible“Our understanding of the formation and character of the three factions of APC in the state vis-a-vis the contents of the briefing from which the reports were developed point to the action as a product of the crafty government faction that depends on blackmail, propaganda and witch-hunt to survive” he added“We are obliged by statements like this to call on the media to do well by indicating clearly the faction of APC from where they sourced the content of their publications”Zamfara State now has three factions of APC namely Former Governor Yari-led faction, Senator Marafa-led faction and that of Governor Bello Matawalle-led factionThis is due to the internal Crisis rocking the party since the build up of the 2919 General Elections“Unless the dispute is settled by competent court of law or acceptable consensus, we want to appeal to the professional standing of the media to properly label reports with their relevant factions to avoid misguided attributions” Bakyasuwa urges the mediaThe Marafa’s Faction also appeal to Governor Bello Matawalle, to minimize his local and international trips and avail self in the state to focus on supervising the various operations of the Nigerian Military against the bandits.
“We are particularly worried that while these operations were going on, the Governor was outside the country attending the traditional wrestling events in Niger Republic.
These and the abysmal absence of developmental projects in the state are not in tendem with the principles and ideals of APC that we know as founding members”

headline: Buhari receives briefing from ex-President Jonathan over Mali crisis -
summarized_story:
Former President Goodluck Jonathan has disclosed that a special meeting of ECOWAS will hold in Ghana, this Sunday, to deliberate on the political situation in Mali.
He made this known at a parley at State House, Abuja, Thursday when he met President Muhammadu as the Head of the ECOWAS Mediation Team.
President Buhari repeated his earlier avowal that whatever Nigeria would do on the Mali situation would be done within the ambit of ECOWAS.

headline: Ladoja breaks silence, says Lekan Balogun is next in line to Olubadan -
summarized_story:
The Osi Olubadan of Ibadanland and former governor of Oyo State, Rashidi Ladoja, has described the controversy trailing succession to the throne of Olubadan is needless.
Egbon Lekan Balogun is the most senior in our line and so he is the next in line to the throne.
“For those asking, my ‘body and mouth language’ is that Egbon Lekan is my senior and he is next in line to the Olubadan stool.
Two weeks after we started the case, Egbon Balogun said he was no longer interested in the case.
Ladoja is the second most senior chief in the Civil Line that is to produce the next Olubadan of Ibadan, following the death of Oba Saliu Adetunji.

headline: Olubadan: Obasanjo pays condolence visit to Oyo gov
summarized_story:
A former Nigerian president, Olusegun Obasanjo has commiserated with Governor of Oyo state, Seyi Makinde over the death of the Olubadan, Oba Saliu Adetunji.
He prayed that the family of the deceased monarchs be consoled and the soul of the late traditional rulers be granted eternal rest.
In his remark, the Deputy Governor of Oyo state Rauf Olaniyan who represented the Governor of Oyo state appreciated the former president for his kind gesture, describing him as an elder statesman who has the interest of his people at heart.
It’s a tag all over your body, and that tag brought you down here even at your age, he said.
Olusegun Obasanjo was accompanied by a former secretary to the Oyo state government, Olayiwola Olakojo, and a highly respected socialite, Otunba Oyewole Fasawe.

headline: Buhari Says He Has Done His Best For Nigeria And Not Expecting Appreciation – Trending With Ojy Okpe
summarized_story:
The President also stated that he is not expecting any appreciation from Nigerians; but hopes that when his administration ends in 2023, Nigerians will recognise that he has served to the best of his abilities.
Samuel Ortom, governor of Benue State, on Thursday; asked President Muhammadu Buhari to declare the Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association; otherwise known as MACBAN, a terrorist organisation.
The Governor’s call is coming after the federal government gazetted an order designating bandits as terrorists.
Ortorm stated, that the security challenges in the nation will only be adequately addressed, if a similar position is taken on the Miyetti Allah Kautal Hore…MACBAN, and the Fulani Nationality Movement otherwise known as FUNAM.
The Governor claims, that these groups have vowed; and have continued to cause mayhem in Benue State and other parts of the country because of the anti-grazing laws.

headline: George Obiozor: IPOB Doesn’t Speak for Igbos
summarized_story:
Professor George Obiozor discussed the president’s unyielding opposition to restructuring and how Nigerians can remedy this by choosing a successor in 2023 that is more in tune with the yearnings of the people.
He also spoke on the chances of an igbo presidency

headline: Nigeria: Entrenched APC Interests Desperate to Blackmail Me, Governors’ Chairman Fayemi Says
summarized_story:
Ekiti State Governor and Chairman of the Nigeria Governors’ Forum (NGF), Dr. Kayode Fayemi, has disclosed that there are some entrenched interests desperately seeking to defame and blackmail, because of the 2023 presidential run, a decision he claimed he never told anyone he was interested.
“For the avoidance of doubt, Dr. Fayemi, has not told anyone that he is in the race for the Presidency of Nigeria.
He has always maintained that he is on duty in Ekiti and would like to concentrate on that assignment.
What he does afterwards is in the hands of God and he will cross that bridge at the appropriate time.
“Some entrenched interests within the ruling All Progressives Congress, however, seem uncomfortable with the rising profile of the NGF Chairman and have resorted to cheap blackmail aimed at de-marketing him.

headline: Shell Places More Onshore Assets in Nigeria for Sale
summarized_story:
Royal Dutch Shell has placed more of its onshore oil assets in Nigeria for sale with at least five Nigerian oil and gas companies preparing to submit their respective bids for the acquisition of the assets this month.
The deal was estimated to fetch up to $3 billion, Reuters quoted three sources involved in the process to have said.
Shell operates SPDC (Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria) and holds a 30 per cent stake in the venture.
NNPC could also choose to exercise its right to pre-empt any sale to a third company, the sources said.
They said it was unclear whether potential bidders could raise sufficient funds as many international banks and investors have become wary about oil and gas assets in Nigeria due to concerns about environmental issues and corruption.

headline: Nigeria: Benue Governor Ortom Wants Miyetti Allah, Fulani Movement Declared as Terrorist Groups
summarized_story:
The Benue State Governor, Samuel Ortom, applauded the Buhari administration for heeding his appeal and finally declaring bandits terrorists.
But the Governor ofcthe North-Central Nigeria state said the president must be bold enough to move a step further to also label some well known violent Fulani groups as terrorists.
“For us in Benue State, the law has come to stay.
In fact, we have maintained our position that Benue State has no grazing routes, reserves or areas whatsoever.
If anyone has failed, it is the Buhari-led APC federal government that has failed by taking Nigeria from top to bottom.
